revised_title: The Emergence of Diamond and Alkali Halides in Solid State Physics
tldr: The article discusses the early beginnings of solid state physics, focusing on the work of Professor R. Pohl. Pohl describes his journey into the field, from studying X-ray diffraction to discovering the photoconductivity in diamond and alkali halides. His work led to significant advancements in the understanding of electronic conduction in crystals and the development of the transistor. Pohl also highlights the historical significance of his research and its applications in biology and technology.
